00054 
00055 long
00056 nof_threads(long _threads){
00057   if (_threads)
00058         return _threads;
00059 
00060 #ifdef _WIN32
00061 #ifndef _SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN
00062   SYSTEM_INFO info;
00063   GetSystemInfo(&info);
00064 #define sysconf(a) info.dwNumberOfProcessors
00065 #define _SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN
00066 #endif
00067 #endif
00068 
00069   long nProcessorsOnline = sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
00070   if (nProcessorsOnline == -1) {
00071         warn ("thread number",
00072                   "Unable to read online processor count.");
00073         return 1;
00074   } else {
00075         return nProcessorsOnline;
00076   }
00077 }

00083 const string Filter::modname="filter";

00091 Filter::Filter(Ftype _tp, float _as)
00092   : filttp(_tp), alsig(_as) {
00093 }
00094 
00095 
00103 Filter::Filter(const string & _name, float _as)
00104   : alsig(_as) {
00105   string name = upper(_name);
00106   if ( name.empty() || name == "NONE" ) filttp = NONE;
00107   else if ( name == "RAMP" || name.empty() ) filttp = RAMP;
00108   else if ( name == "BARLETT") filttp = RAMP;
00109   else if ( name == "WELCH") filttp = WELCH;
00110   else if ( name == "PARZEN") filttp = PARZEN;
00111   else if ( name == "HANN") filttp = HANN;
00112   else if ( name == "HAMMING") filttp = HAMMING;
00113   else if ( name == "BLACKMAN") filttp = BLACKMAN;
00114   else if ( name == "LANCKZOS") filttp = LANCKZOS;
00115   else if ( name == "KAISER") filttp = KAISER;
00116   else if ( name == "GAUSS") filttp = GAUSS;
00117   else throw_error(modname, "The string \""+ _name +"\""
00118                                    " does not describe any known filter.");
00119   //check_alsig();
00120 }
00121 
00126 string
00127 Filter::name() const {
00128   switch (filttp) {
00129   case NONE:     return "NONE";
00130   case RAMP:     return "RAMP";
00131   case BARLETT:  return "BARLETT";
00132   case WELCH:    return "WELCH";
00133   case PARZEN:   return "PARZEN";
00134   case HANN:     return "HANN";
00135   case HAMMING:  return "HAMMING";
00136   case BLACKMAN: return "BLACKMAN";
00137   case LANCKZOS: return "LANCKZOS";
00138   case KAISER:   return "KAISER";
00139   case GAUSS:    return "GAUSS";
00140   default :
00141     throw_bug(__FUNCTION__);
00142     return "";
00143   }
00144 }
00145 
00150 Filter::Ftype
00151 Filter::filter() const {
00152   return filttp;
00153 }
00154 
00155 
00156 
00167 Line &
00168 Filter::fill(Line & filt, int pixels) const {
00169 
00170   if ( ! pixels ) pixels = filt.size();
00171   else filt.resize(pixels);
00172   if ( ! pixels )
00173         throw_error(modname, "Zero-size filter requested.");
00174 
00175   filt = 0.0;
00176   filt(0) = 0.25;
00177   for ( int pix = 1 ; pix < pixels/2 ; pix += 2)
00178     filt(pix) = -1.0/(pix*pix*M_PI*M_PI);
00179   fftwf_plan planZ = fftwf_plan_r2r_1d (pixels, filt.data(), filt.data(),
00180                                                                                 FFTW_HC2R, FFTW_ESTIMATE);
00181   fftwf_execute(planZ);
00182   fftwf_destroy_plan(planZ);
00183 
00184   /*
00185   for ( int pix = 0 ; pix < pixels ; pix++)
00186     filt(pix) = ( pix < pixels/2)  ?  pix  :  pixels - pix;
00187   filt /= pixels;
00188   */
00189 
00190   for ( int pix = 0 ; pix < pixels ; pix++) {
00191 
00192         float fp = (pix < pixels/2) ? pix : pixels - pix;
00193         fp *= 2.0/pixels;
00194 
00195         switch (filttp) {
00196 
00197         case NONE:
00198         case RAMP:
00199           fp = 1.0;
00200           break;
00201 
00202         case BARLETT:
00203           fp = (1-fp);
00204           break;
00205 
00206         case WELCH:
00207           fp = (1-fp*fp);
00208           break;
00209 
00210         case PARZEN:
00211           fp = (fp <= 0.5) ?
00212                 1-6*fp*fp + 3*fp*fp*fp : 2*(1+fp*fp*fp);
00213           break;
00214 
00215         case HANN:
00216           fp = 0.5 * ( 1 + cos(M_PI*fp) );
00217           break;
00218 
00219         case HAMMING:
00220           fp = 0.54+0.46*cos(M_PI*fp);
00221           break;
00222 
00223         case BLACKMAN:
00224           fp = ( 0.42 + 0.5*cos(M_PI*fp)+0.08*cos(2*M_PI*fp));
00225           break;
00226 
00227         case LANCKZOS:
00228           fp = (fp==0.0) ? 0.0 : abs(sin(M_PI*fp))/fp;
00229           break;
00230 
00231         case KAISER:
00232           fp = gsl_sf_bessel_I0(alsig*sqrt(1-fp*fp)) /
00233                 gsl_sf_bessel_I0(alsig) ;
00234           break;
00235 
00236         case GAUSS:
00237           fp = pow( (float) 2.0, (float) -fp*fp/(alsig*alsig)) ;
00238           break;
00239 
00240         }
00241 
00242     // Here 2.0 appears because of the R2HC-HC2R FFT pair.
00243         filt(pix) *= fp/2.0;
00244 
00245   }
00246 
00247   return filt;
00248 
00249 }
00250 
00251 bool
00252 operator==(const Filter & a, const Filter & b){
00253   return a.filter() == b.filter();
00254 }
00255 
00256 bool
00257 operator!=(const Filter & a, const Filter & b){
00258   return a.filter() != b.filter();
00259 }

00261 const string FilterOptionDesc=
00262   "Must be a string consisting of two parts (the second one is optional):"
00263   " the filter name and float parameter of the filter. The filter name"
00264   " can be one of the following (case insensitive):\n"
00265   "    RAMP\n"
00266   "    BARLETT\n"
00267   "    WELCH\n"
00268   "    PARZEN\n"
00269   "    HANN\n"
00270   "    HAMMING\n"
00271   "    BLACKMAN\n"
00272   "    LANCKZOS\n"
00273   "    KAISER\n"
00274   "    GAUSS\n"
00275   "Optional float value is required only if the filter is KAISER or GAUSS"
00276   " and represents the \\alpha parameter of the KAISER filter or \\sigma"
00277   " parameter of the GAUSS filter. Description of the filtering functions"
00278   " and their graphs can be found in the html documentation.";
00279 
00280 string
00281 type_desc (Filter*){
00282   return "STRING[:FLOAT]";
00283 }
00284 
00285 bool
00286 _conversion (Filter* _val, const string & in) {
00287   float alsig;
00288   std::string::size_type idx=in.find(':');
00289   if (idx == std::string::npos){
00290         *_val = Filter(in);
00291   } else {
00292         if ( ! poptmx::_conversion(&alsig, in.substr(idx+1)) )
00293           return false;
00294         *_val = Filter(in.substr(0,idx), alsig);
00295   }
00296   return true;
00297 }

00319 static const int TR_conf = 1 << 16;
00320 
00321 
00329 static inline void
00330 filter_line(Line & ln, const Line & f_win,
00331                         const fftwf_plan *planF, const fftwf_plan *planB){
00332   float *lnp = ln.data();
00333   fftwf_execute_r2r( *planF, lnp, lnp);
00334   ln *= f_win;
00335   fftwf_execute_r2r( *planB, lnp, lnp);
00336   ln /= ln.size(); // normalization of the data.
00337 }
00338 
00346 static void
00347 project_line(const Line & sino, Map & result, float Theta, float center) {
00348 
00349   int pixels = sino.size();
00350   float abcenter = abs(center);
00351   int nPp = pixels/2;
00352   float radius =  nPp - abcenter;
00353 
00354   float *resultp = result.data();
00355   const float *sinop = sino.data();
00356 
00357   int ncos_theta = (int) (TR_conf * cos(Theta));
00358   int nsin_theta = (int) (TR_conf * sin(Theta));
00359   int t_axis_cp  = (int)
00360         (TR_conf *
00361          ( center + ( 1 - cos(Theta) - sin(Theta) ) * pixels / 2.0 ));
00362 
00363   int t_axis, delta;
00364   float *tresultp;
00365   for ( int xpix = (int)(abcenter) ; xpix < (int)(pixels-abcenter) ; xpix++){
00366     delta = (nPp - xpix);
00367     delta = (int) (sqrt(radius*radius - delta*delta ) - 1) ;
00368     t_axis = t_axis_cp + xpix * ncos_theta;
00369     tresultp = resultp + pixels*xpix;
00370     for ( int ypix = nPp - delta; ypix < nPp+delta ; ypix++)
00371       *(tresultp + ypix) +=
00372         *( sinop + ( t_axis + ypix * nsin_theta ) / TR_conf );
00373   }
00374 }
00375 
00376 
00383 static inline void
00384 project_sino(const Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center) {
00385   //int pixels = sinogram.columns();
00386   int thetas = sinogram.rows();
00387   for (int iTheta = 0 ; iTheta < thetas ; iTheta++) {
00388         Line sinoline = sinogram(iTheta, blitz::Range::all());
00389         project_line(sinoline, result, (M_PI * iTheta)/thetas, center);
00390   }
00391 }
00392

00397 
00398 
00407 class line_distributor {
00408 
00409 private:
00410 
00411   int iTheta;                                   
00412   int thetas;                                   
00413   const Map & sinogram;        
00414   Map & _result;                                
00415   float _center;                                
00416 
00417   pthread_mutex_t lock;         
00418 
00419 public:
00420 
00427   line_distributor(const Map & _sinogram, Map & _res, float _cent)
00428         : sinogram(_sinogram), _result(_res), _center(_cent) {
00429     iTheta = 0;
00430         thetas = sinogram.rows();
00431     if ( pthread_mutex_init(&lock, NULL) != 0 )
00432       throw_error("line_distributor", "Failed to initialize the mutex.");
00433   }
00434 
00436   inline ~line_distributor(){
00437     pthread_mutex_destroy(&lock);
00438   }
00439 
00444   inline Map & result() const {return _result;}
00445 
00450   inline float center() const {return _center;}
00451 
00460   inline bool distribute(float *Theta, Line & sinoline){
00461     pthread_mutex_lock(&lock);
00462         bool returned = iTheta < thetas;
00463         if ( returned ) {
00464           sinoline.reference( sinogram(iTheta, blitz::Range::all()) );
00465           *Theta = (M_PI * iTheta)/thetas;
00466           iTheta++;
00467         }
00468     pthread_mutex_unlock(&lock);
00469     return returned;
00470   }
00471 
00472 };
00473 
00480 static inline void *
00481 project_line_thr ( void * _args) {
00482   line_distributor * args = (line_distributor *) _args;
00483   Map & result = args->result();
00484   float center = args->center();
00485 
00486   Line sinoline;
00487   float Theta;
00488   while ( args->distribute( &Theta, sinoline )  )
00489     project_line ( sinoline, result, Theta, center);
00490   return 0;
00491 }
00492 
00500 static inline void
00501 project_sino( const Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center, int threads ) {
00502 
00503   if (threads == 1) {
00504         project_sino (sinogram, result, center);
00505         return;
00506   }
00507 
00508   // Here I will assume that all threads can write to the same result array
00509   // without the interference. However, it is not absolutely correct, but
00510   // even if a small number of threads are interfering, the influence
00511   // can be hardly noticed.
00512   //
00513   // If you want to avoid the interference effect, you should create
00514   // line_distributor for each thread with it's own result array and then
00515   // sum all these results after the threads had finished.
00516 
00517   //int pixels = sinogram.columns();
00518   //int thetas = sinogram.rows();
00519   line_distributor args(sinogram, result, center);
00520   vector<pthread_t> ntid(threads);
00521 
00522   for (int ith = 0 ; ith < threads ; ith++)
00523     if ( pthread_create( & ntid[ith], NULL, project_line_thr, &args ) )
00524       throw_error("project sino in thread", "Can't create thread.");
00525 
00526   for (int ith = 0 ; ith < threads ; ith++)
00527     pthread_join( ntid[ith], 0);
00528 
00529 }

00535 
00536 const string CTrec::modname = "reconstruction";
00537 
00540 const float CTrec::zPad = 2.0;
00541 
00542 
00543 
00544 
00545 
00558 void
00559 CTrec::reconstruct_uni(Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center) const {
00560 
00561   if ( _contrast == Contrast::ABS )
00562     sinogram = -log(sinogram);
00563 
00564   const int zShift = (int)(_pixels*(zPad-1)/2);
00565   const int thetas = sinogram.rows();
00566   Line zsinoline((int)(_pixels*zPad)); // zero-padded sinoline.
00567 
00568   if ( _contrast != Contrast::FLT ) {
00569     for (int iTheta = 0 ; iTheta < thetas ; iTheta++) {
00570 
00571       Line sinoline = sinogram(iTheta, blitz::Range::all());
00572 
00573       zsinoline = 0;
00574       zsinoline(blitz::Range(zShift, zShift+_pixels)) = sinoline;
00575       filter_line(zsinoline, filt_window, &planF, &planB);
00576       sinoline = zsinoline(blitz::Range(zShift, zShift+_pixels));
00577 
00578       if ( _contrast == Contrast::REF )
00579         partial_sum( sinoline.begin(), sinoline.end(), sinoline.begin() );
00580 
00581     }
00582   }
00583 
00584   project_sino(sinogram, result, center, _threads);
00585 
00586 }
00587 
00595 void
00596 CTrec::addLine_uni(Line &sinoline, Map &result, const float Theta, const float center) const {
00597 
00598   if ( _contrast == Contrast::ABS )
00599     sinoline = -log(sinoline);
00600 
00601   if ( _contrast != Contrast::FLT ) {
00602 
00603     const int zShift = (int)(_pixels*(zPad-1)/2);
00604     Line zsinoline((int)(_pixels*zPad)); // zero-padded sinoline.
00605 
00606     zsinoline = 0;
00607     zsinoline(blitz::Range(zShift, zShift+_pixels)) = sinoline;
00608     filter_line(zsinoline, filt_window, &planF, &planB);
00609     sinoline = zsinoline(blitz::Range(zShift, zShift+_pixels));
00610 
00611   }
00612 
00613   if ( _contrast == Contrast::REF )
00614     partial_sum( sinoline.begin(), sinoline.end(), sinoline.begin() );
00615 
00616   project_line(sinoline, result, Theta, center);
00617 
00618 }
00619 
00620 
00621 
00628 void
00629 CTrec::reconstruct(Map &sinogram, Map &result, const float center) const {
00630 
00631 
00632   if ( sinogram.columns() != _pixels )
00633         throw_error ( modname, "The width of the input array"
00634                                   " (" + toString(sinogram.columns()) + ") does not match the"
00635                                   " requested reconstruction width "
00636                                   " (" + toString(_pixels) + ")." );
00637   if ( abs(center) >= _pixels/2 )
00638         throw_error(modname, "The rotation center is outside the image:"
00639                                 " Image width: " + toString(_pixels) + ", the deviation"
00640                                 " of the rotation axis from the center of the image: "
00641                                 + toString(center) + ".");
00642 
00643 
00644   result.resize(_pixels, _pixels);
00645   result = 0.0;
00646 
00647   if ( ! sinogram.isStorageContiguous() ) sinogram.reference( sinogram.copy() );
00648   if ( ! result  .isStorageContiguous() ) result  .reference( result  .copy() );
00649 
00650   if (_contrast == Contrast::ABS) unzero(sinogram);
00651 
00652   (this->*_reconstruct)(sinogram, result, center);
00653 
00654 }
00655 
00663 void
00664 CTrec::addLine(Line &sinoline, Map &result, const float Theta, const float center) const {
00665 
00666   if ( sinoline.size() != _pixels )
00667         throw_error ( modname, "The width of the input sinogram line"
00668                                   " (" + toString(sinoline.size()) + ") does not match the"
00669                                   " requested reconstruction width "
00670                                   " (" + toString(_pixels) + ")." );
00671   if ( result.shape() != Shape(_pixels, _pixels) )
00672         throw_error(modname, "The size of the result array"
00673                 " (" + toString(result.columns()) + ":" + toString(result.rows()) + ")"
00674                                 " does not match the requested reconstruction width"
00675                 " (" + toString(_pixels) + ").");
00676   if ( abs(center) >= _pixels/2 )
00677         throw_error(modname, "The rotation center is outside the image:"
00678                                 " Image width: " + toString(_pixels) + ", the deviation"
00679                                 " of the rotation axis from the center of the image: "
00680                                 + toString(center) + ".");
00681 
00682   if ( ! sinoline.isStorageContiguous() ) sinoline.reference( sinoline.copy() );
00683   if ( ! result  .isStorageContiguous() ) result  .reference( result  .copy() );
00684 
00685   if (_contrast == Contrast::ABS) unzero(sinoline);
00686 
00687   (this->*_addLine)(sinoline, result, Theta, center);
00688 
00689 
00690 
00691 }

00736 
00744 CTrec::CTrec(int px, Contrast cn, int tr, const Filter & ft)
00745   : _pixels(px), _contrast(cn), _threads(tr), _filter(ft) {
00746   pixels(_pixels);
00747   filter(_filter);
00748   contrast(_contrast);
00749   threads(_threads);
00750   choose_algorithm();
00751 }
00752 
00759 CTrec::CTrec(int px, Contrast cn, const Filter & ft)
00760   : _pixels(px), _contrast(cn), _threads(0), _filter(ft) {
00761   pixels(_pixels);
00762   filter(_filter);
00763   contrast(_contrast);
00764   threads(_threads);
00765   choose_algorithm();
00766 }
00767 
00778 void
00779 CTrec::pixels(int px){
00780   _pixels=px;
00781   if (_pixels <= 1)
00782         throw_error (modname, "Number of pixels in the CT reconstruction"
00783                                  + toString(_pixels) + ": less or equal to 1.");
00784   planF = fftwf_plan_r2r_1d ((int)(_pixels*zPad), 0, 0, FFTW_R2HC, FFTW_ESTIMATE);
00785   planB = fftwf_plan_r2r_1d ((int)(_pixels*zPad), 0, 0, FFTW_HC2R, FFTW_ESTIMATE);
00786   filter(_filter);
00787 }
00788 
00793 void
00794 CTrec::contrast(Contrast cn){
00795   _contrast=cn;
00796   choose_algorithm();
00797 }
00798 
00803 void
00804 CTrec::filter(const Filter & ft){
00805   filt_window.resize((int)(_pixels*zPad));
00806   _filter = ft;
00807   _filter.fill(filt_window);
00808   filt_window *= zPad;
00809   if ( _contrast == Contrast::REF ) filt_window(0)=0.0;
00810 }
00811 
00816 void
00817 CTrec::threads(int tr=1){
00818   _threads = nof_threads(tr);
00819   choose_algorithm();
00820 }
00821 
00822 
00829 void
00830 CTrec::choose_algorithm(){
00831   switch (_contrast.contrast()) {
00832   case Contrast::ABS:
00833     _reconstruct = ( _threads == 1 ) ?
00834           &CTrec::reconstruct_abs : &CTrec::reconstruct_abs_thr;
00835     _addLine = &CTrec::addLine_abs;
00836         break;
00837   case Contrast::REF:
00838     _reconstruct = ( _threads == 1 ) ?
00839           &CTrec::reconstruct_ref : &CTrec::reconstruct_ref_thr;
00840     _addLine = &CTrec::addLine_ref;
00841         break;
00842   case Contrast::PHS:
00843     _reconstruct = &CTrec::reconstruct_uni;
00844     _addLine = &CTrec::addLine_uni;
00845     break;
00846   case Contrast::FLT:
00847     _reconstruct = &CTrec::reconstruct_uni;
00848     _addLine = &CTrec::addLine_uni;
00849     break;
00850   default :
00851     warn(modname, "Do not know how to reconstruct contrast type \""
00852          + _contrast.name() + "\". Will use standard reconstruction method.");
00853     _reconstruct = &CTrec::reconstruct_uni;
00854     _addLine = &CTrec::addLine_uni;
00855         break;
00856   }
00857 }
00858

00868 void
00869 CTrec::reconstruct_abs(Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center) const {
00870   reconstruct_uni(sinogram, result, center);
00871 }

00880 void
00881 CTrec::reconstruct_ref(Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center) const {
00882   reconstruct_uni(sinogram, result, center);
00883 }
00884 
00892 void
00893 CTrec::reconstruct_abs_thr(Map &sinogram, Map &result, float center) const {
00894   reconstruct_uni(sinogram, result, center);
00895 }

00897 
00905 void

00934 
00935 void
00936 CTrec::finilize(Map & result, int thetas, float pixelSize) {
00937   // \Delta\Theta = \pi/thetas comes from the integration over \Theta.
00938   // The pixelSize is missing inside the CT algorithm in the filtering function Filter::fill().
00939   result *= M_PI / ( pixelSize * thetas);
00940 }
00941 
00942 
00943 
00944 
00945 
00946 
00947 
00948 
00949 
00950 void
00951 ts_add( Map &projection, Map &result, const Filter & filter,
00952                 const float center, const Contrast contrast,
00953                 const float angle, const int plane){
00954 
00955   if ( contrast == Contrast::ABS )
00956         projection = -log(projection);
00957 
00958   int pixels = projection.columns();
00959   int thetas = projection.rows();
00960   if ( result.columns() != pixels ||
00961        result.rows()    != thetas)
00962     throw_error ( "tomosynthesis", "The size of the result array"
00963                   " does not match the requested reconstruction." );
00964 
00965   Line f_win;
00966   filter.fill(f_win, pixels);
00967 
00968   fftwf_plan
00969     planF = fftwf_plan_r2r_1d (pixels, 0, 0, FFTW_R2HC, FFTW_ESTIMATE),
00970     planB = fftwf_plan_r2r_1d (pixels, 0, 0, FFTW_HC2R, FFTW_ESTIMATE);
00971 
00972   float cur_sin = sin(angle);
00973   float cur_cos = cos(angle);
00974   float plane_cos = (plane-center)*cur_sin;
00975   float Rcenter = pixels*0.5 + center;
00976 
00977   for (int ycur = 0 ; ycur < thetas ; ycur++){
00978 
00979         Line ln = projection(ycur, blitz::Range::all());
00980 
00981         // filtering
00982         filter_line(ln, f_win, &planF, &planB);
00983         if ( contrast == Contrast::REF )
00984           partial_sum( ln.begin(), ln.end(), ln.begin() );
00985 
00986         // projecting
00987         for (int xcur = 0 ; xcur < pixels ; xcur++) {
00988           float di = ( xcur - Rcenter )*cur_cos - plane_cos + Rcenter;
00989           di = (di < 0) ?
00990                 0 :
00991                 (di >=pixels ) ? pixels - 1 : di;
00992           result(ycur, xcur) += projection(ycur, int(di));
00993         }
00994 
00995   }
00996 
00997   fftwf_destroy_plan(planF);
00998   fftwf_destroy_plan(planB);
00999 
01000 }

01010 
01011 const string CenterOptionDesc=
01012   "Deviation of the rotation axis from the center of the sinogram.\n"
01013   "Allows you to erase some minor artifacts in the reconstructed image"
01014   " which come from the inaccurate rotation position. In most real"
01015   " CT or TS experiments the rotation center of the sample"
01016   " is not exactly in the center of the recoded projection. Moreover,"
01017   " the rotation axis may be inclined from the vertical orientation."
01018   " If the inclination of the rotation axis is noticeable for your desired"
01019   " spatial resolution then you should rotate the images before the actual"
01020   " reconstruction. You can do it in the batch using \"mogrify\" command"
01021   " from the ImageMagick package with the -rotate option.";
